article.titre: A Scalable MMR Approach to Sentence Scoring for Multi-Document Update Summarization

auteurs.auteur: Florian Boudin ♮ and Marc El-B`eze ♮ ♮ Laboratoire Informatique d’Avignon 339 chemin des Meinajaries, BP1228, 84911 Avignon Cedex 9, France. florian.boudin@univ-avignon.fr marc.elbeze@univ-avignon.fr Juan-Manuel Torres-Moreno ♮,♭ juan-manuel.torres@univ-avignon.fr

article.abstract: We present SMMR, a scalable sentence scoring method for query-oriented update summarization. Sentences are scored thanks to a criterion combining query relevance and dissimilarity with already read documents (history). As the amount of data in history increases, non-redundancy is prioritized over query-relevance. We show that SMMR achieves promising results on the DUC 2007 update corpus.
